abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Tanzania Emergency Power
            Supply Project were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            significant, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: 1) a key lesson learned is that,
            in certain cases, an emergency operation can be a fitting
            vehicle to carry forward sector dialogue while averting the
            collapse of the power sector due to natural or other crises;
            2) the Bank should consider developing a methodology for
            estimating monitoring indicators to gauge the efficacy of
            emergency receptions; and 3) demand side management measures
            can be an important complement to emergency power.
